"all" style='page-break-before:auto'></span>
<div class="WordSection5">
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<div style=
'border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt; background:#E0E0E0'>
<h1 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in;background:#E0E0E0'>
<a name="_Ref21928338" id="_Ref21928338"></a><a name="_Toc23046376"
id="_Toc23046376"></a><a name="_Toc26088573" id=
"_Toc26088573">Section 2 <span style='color:black'>: Material
Keywords</span></a></h1>
</div>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">This section deals with two keywords related
to the constituent materials that will form the repeating unit cell
or laminate&nbsp;to be analyzed by MAC/GMC 4.0.&nbsp; These
keywords are used to provide the code with the constituent material
properties&nbsp;that will occupy the subcells in the analyzed
repeating unit cell (RUC) or repeating unit cells that represent
each ply&nbsp;of the laminate.&nbsp; Then, using keywords described
in Section 3, the RUC is constructed using subcells, which contain
some or all of the constituent materials.&nbsp; If the MAC/GMC 4.0
problem involves a laminate, the laminate is constructed of layers,
each of which is represented by an RUC.&nbsp; The RUC for each
layer is then constructed of subcells containing the constituent
materials.&nbsp; Because the constituent materials always occupy
subcells within an RUC, they can also be thought of as subcell
materials.&nbsp; However, the subcell materials are not necessarily
elastic or isotropic.&nbsp; MAC/GMC 4.0 handles a wide range of
material visco-elasto-plastic material behavior and material
anisotropy on the level of the subcell.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">The two MAC/GMC 4.0 input file&nbsp;keywords
covered in this section are:</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*MDBPATH</span>
<span style='font-family:Symbol'>&REG;</span> Specifies name and
location of the external material database&nbsp;file.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span>
<span style='font-family:Symbol'>&REG;</span> Specifies the
properties of constituent materials that will occupy subcells.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">As one might expect, there are several ways in
which MAC/GMC 4.0 can obtain the material properties&nbsp;for the
constituent materials.&nbsp; These include:</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in'>
1)<span style=
'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>
Reading the properties directly from the MAC/GMC 4.0 input
file.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in'>
2)<span style=
'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>
Obtaining the properties from the internal MAC/GMC 4.0 material
database.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in'>
3)<span style=
'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>
Reading the properties from a user&CloseCurlyQuote;s personal
external material database&nbsp;file.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in'>
4)<span style=
'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>
Obtaining the properties from a user-defined&nbsp;subroutine that
calculates them based on a specified function.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">In addition, different material
properties&nbsp;are required for different analysis types and
constitutive models.&nbsp; For example, if the user indicates that
effective thermal conductivities should be calculated by the code
(by including <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONDUCTIVITY</span> in
the input file), the thermal conductivities of the constituent
materials must be specified in <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span>.&nbsp;
Similarly, if the user chooses an inelastic constitutive model for
a particular constituent material rather than a linear
elastic&nbsp;constitutive model, material parameters for the
particular inelastic constitutive model must be specified in
addition to the material elastic constants.&nbsp; Because of this
specialization of the constitutive material properties for many of
the different problems that MAC/GMC 4.0 can solve, the data
specification associated with the <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span>
keyword is also quite specific compared to the other input
parameters associated with the problem.&nbsp; As such, the part of
this section dealing with the <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span>
keyword is the longest and most involved component of this
manual.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">It is important to realize that the employed
constituent material property units&nbsp;must be consistent.&nbsp;
That is, all constituent materials that comprise an RUC or
laminate&nbsp;must employ the same units.&nbsp; The units of the
material properties&nbsp;within the MAC/GMC 4.0 internal material
database&nbsp;are given in Table 2.2.&nbsp; Both ksi&nbsp;and
MPa&nbsp;are used for the material property stress (and stiffness)
unit.&nbsp; The time unit&nbsp;for all material properties is
seconds, the temperature&nbsp;unit&nbsp;is <span style=
'font-family:Symbol'>&deg;</span>C, and the strain values are
unitless (as opposed to %).&nbsp; Note also that any applied
loading&nbsp;should be specified in units consistent with the
material property units.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
</div>
<span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'><br clear=
"all" style='page-break-before:auto'></span>
<div class="WordSection6">
<div style=
'border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'>
<h2 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046377"
id="_Toc23046377"></a><a name="_Toc26088574" id=
"_Toc26088574">*MDBPATH</a>: <span class=
"StyleHeading214ptNotBoldChar"><span style=
'font-size:14.0pt'>External material database file &
location</span></span></h2>
</div>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046378"
id="_Toc23046378"></a><a name="_Toc26088575" id=
"_Toc26088575">Purpose:</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">Specify the name and path to an external
material database&nbsp;file.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046379"
id="_Toc23046379"></a><a name="_Toc26088576" id=
"_Toc26088576">Usage:</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1Char">*MDBPATH</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; <span style='color:blue'>PATH=</span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>mat_path</span></span>
NAME=<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>mat_name</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<table class="MsoNormalTable" border="0" cellspacing="0"
cellpadding="0" style='margin-left:5.4pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
<tr>
<td width="78" valign="top" style=
'width:58.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal"><u><span style=
'font-family:"Verdana",sans-serif'>Name</span></u></p>
</td>
<td width="510" valign="top" style=
'width:382.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal"><u><span style=
'font-family:"Verdana",sans-serif'>Definition</span></u></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="78" valign="top" style=
'width:58.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal"><i><span style=
'color:blue'>mat_path</span><sup>1</sup></i></p>
</td>
<td width="510" valign="top" style=
'width:382.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal">Computer directory&nbsp;path&nbsp;to the
external material database&nbsp;file <i><span style=
'color:blue'>(Optional)</span></i></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="78" valign="top" style=
'width:58.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal"><i>mat_name</i></p>
</td>
<td width="510" valign="top" style=
'width:382.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal">Name of the external material
database&nbsp;file with extension</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046380"
id="_Toc23046380"></a><a name="_Toc26088577" id=
"_Toc26088577">Examples:</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1Char">*MDBPATH</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; NAME=sample_material_database.mat</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1Char">*MDBPATH</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; PATH=c:\mac4\mat_db\ NAME=sample_material_database.mat</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;</p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046381"
id="_Toc23046381"></a><a name="_Toc26088578" id=
"_Toc26088578">Associated MAC/GMC 4.0 Example Problem(s):</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><b>Example 2h</b></p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;</p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046382"
id="_Toc23046382"></a><a name="_Toc26088579" id=
"_Toc26088579">Notes:</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
1)&nbsp;&nbsp; If the optional&nbsp;<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>PATH=</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>mat_path</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>is
omitted, the code will look for the external material
database</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;file
in the same directory</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;as
the input file</span></span>.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
2)&nbsp;&nbsp; A sample external material database&nbsp;file,
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt'>sample_material_database.mat</span></span>, is
distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0.&nbsp; This sample file is used in
Example Problem 2h.&nbsp; A print out of this sample file is given
in the Appendix of this manual.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
3)&nbsp;&nbsp; The format of the external material
database&nbsp;file is similar to the user-defined&nbsp;material
property input format employed when the properties are specified
directly in the input file.&nbsp; The specifics of the external
material database file format are discussed under the <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span>
keyword in the present section of this manual.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
4)&nbsp;&nbsp; To choose a particular material from the external
material database&nbsp;file, specific input is required under
<span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span> in
order&nbsp;to specify the name of the material from the external
material database file and that the code should look for the
particular material in the external database file (see <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span> in
the present section of this manual).</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
5)&nbsp;&nbsp; MAC/GMC 4.0 does not read in and store all
constituent materials in the external material
database&nbsp;file.&nbsp; The code only reads and stores the
materials specified under <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span>.&nbsp;
Thus, requirements that apply to all constituent materials only
apply to those that are actually read from the external material
database file.&nbsp; For example, electromagnetic&nbsp;analysis
requires that all constituent materials have the electromagnetic
specifier&nbsp;(<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>EM=</span></span>)
included.&nbsp; If using an external material database, this
requirement would not apply to every material appearing in the
external material database file.&nbsp; It would only apply to those
read by MAC/GMC 4.0 as specified under <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span> in
the particular input file&nbsp;being employed.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>

id="_Toc23046383"></a><a name="_Toc26088580" id=

'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">MAC/GMC 4.0 Keywords Manual Section 2
(<span class=

<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046385"
id="_Toc23046385"></a><a name="_Toc26088582" id=

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">Specify the constituent material constitutive
models and material properties&nbsp;that will be read and stored by
MAC/GMC 4.0.&nbsp; The local constitutive models supported by
MAC/GMC 4.0 are listed in Table 2.1.&nbsp; Each is described in
detail in the MAC/GMC 4.0 Theory Manual&nbsp;Section 4.</p>

'font-size:13.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>

and linking with the MAC/GMC 4.0 library file&nbsp;<span class=

<p class="MsoNormal"><sup><span style=
'font-family:"Wingdings 2"'>&hellip;</span></sup>&nbsp; Non-U.S.
government users may require an additional software license to use
this constitutive model</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">The material information specified under
<span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span> has
many special cases based on the options chosen by the user and can
become somewhat complicated.&nbsp; As such, the description for
this keyword has been written in outline form in order&nbsp;to
present the input requirements as simply as possible.&nbsp; Each
outline heading has its own Usage description and Examples.&nbsp;
The Notes have been consolidated and placed at the end of each
capital lettered section.&nbsp;&nbsp; The outline format for the
<span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONSTITUENTS</span>
keyword is:</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<div style=
'border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt; background:#CCFFFF'>

<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=

<p class="MsoNormal"><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=

<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=

&ndash;&nbsp;</span></span></p>

2)&nbsp;&nbsp; In all other cases <span class=

<p class=

<p class=

<p class=

<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046403"
id="_Toc23046403"></a><a name="_Toc26088598" id=
"_Toc26088598">Associated MAC/GMC 4.0 Example Problem(s):</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<h6 style='margin:0in'>Example 2g</h6>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;</p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046405"
id="_Toc23046405"></a><a name="_Toc26088599" id=
"_Toc26088599">Additional Information:</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">MAC/GMC 4.0 Keywords Manual Appendix</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046409"
id="_Toc23046409"></a><a name="_Toc23046394" id=
"_Toc23046394"></a><a name="_Toc26088600" id=
"_Toc26088600">Notes:</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
1)&nbsp;&nbsp; <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>TREF=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>tref</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>is only
required in the special case</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;when
the code cannot determine at what
temperature</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;the
material properties</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;should
be taken.&nbsp; This special case occurs when:</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol;font-style:normal'>&CenterDot;</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>Thermal
loading</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;is
not specified (</span></span><span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*THERM</span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>omitted)</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&ndash; AND &ndash;&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol;font-style:normal'>&CenterDot;</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>Material
properties are taken from the internal material
database</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span>(<i>matid</i>
<span style='font-family:Symbol'>&sup1;</span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>U</span></span>)</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:9.0pt'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&ndash; OR
&ndash;&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:9.0pt'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>Material
properties are user-defined</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span>(<i>matid</i>
= <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>U</span></span>)<span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>&nbsp;
&ndash; AND &ndash;&nbsp; temperature</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>-dependent</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
2)&nbsp;&nbsp; In all other cases <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>TREF=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>tref</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>is
optional</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><u><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>Warning</span></u></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>:
Specifying</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>TREF=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>tref</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>will
override the temperature</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;dependence
and cause the code to employ
temperature-independent</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;material
properties</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;for
the material taken at the temperature </span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;color:blue'>tref</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
3)&nbsp;&nbsp; To obtain isotropic material behavior, set,
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>E<sub>A</sub>&nbsp;</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>=</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>E<sub>T</sub>,</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol'>n</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><sub><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>A</span></sub></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>=</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol'>n</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><sub><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>T</span></sub></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>,</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>G<sub>A</sub></span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>=</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>E<sub>A</sub></span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>/
2(1+</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol'>n</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><sub><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>A</span></sub></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>),
and</span></span> <span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol'>a</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><sub><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>A</span></sub></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>=</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol'>a</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><sub><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>T</span></sub></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
4)&nbsp;&nbsp; <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>NP=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>np</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>is only
required in the special case</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;that
the material constitutive model</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;is
classical incremental plasticity</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;(</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>cmod</span></span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>=21</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>).&nbsp;
A maximum value of</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>NP=9</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue;font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>may
be specified.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
5)&nbsp;&nbsp; The lines associated with the visco-inelastic
material properties&nbsp;(<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>VI=</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>&nbsp;vi(1),</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;color:blue;font-style:normal'>&hellip;</span></span>,
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>V<sub>j</sub>=</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>V<sub>j</sub>(i),</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;color:blue;font-style:normal'>&hellip;</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>)
are only required in the special case</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;when
the constitutive model</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;(</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>cmod</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>)
chosen is an inelastic model.&nbsp; This occurs
when:</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style='text-align:center'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>cmod</span></span><span style='font-family:Symbol'>&sup1;</span><u>6</u>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>&nbsp;</span></span>&ndash;
AND &ndash; <span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>&nbsp;cmod</span></span><span style='font-family:Symbol'>&sup1;</span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>9</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>&nbsp;</span></span>&ndash;
AND &ndash; <span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>&nbsp;cmod</span></span><span style='font-family:Symbol'>&sup1;</span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>15</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
6)&nbsp;&nbsp; <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>D=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>d<sub>1</sub>,d<sub>2</sub>,d<sub>3</sub></span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>is only
required in the special case</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;when
the specified material constitutive model</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;is
on e that admits local transverse isotropy.&nbsp; This occurs
when:</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style='text-align:center'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>cmod</span></span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>=3</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>&nbsp;</span></span>&ndash;
OR &ndash; <span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>&nbsp;cmod</span></span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>=7</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>&nbsp;</span></span>&ndash;
AND &ndash; <span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>&nbsp;cmod</span></span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>=9</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
7)&nbsp;&nbsp; The thermal conductivity specifiers (<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>K=</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:Symbol;color:blue'>k</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><sub><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>A</span></sub></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;color:blue'>,</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:Symbol;color:blue'>k</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><sub><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>T</span></sub></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>,</span></span>
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>KA=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol;color:blue'>k</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><sub><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>A</span></sub></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;color:blue'>,&hellip;</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>,</span></span>
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>KT=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol;color:blue'>k</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><sub><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>T</span></sub></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;color:blue'>,&hellip;</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>)
are only required in the special case</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;when
the code is calculating effective thermal conductivities of the
RUC.&nbsp; This occurs when the</span></span> <span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*CONDUCTIVITY</span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>keyword is
specified.&nbsp; The thermal conductivity</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;specification
is only valid for materials that are isotropic or transversely
isotropic</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;with
an x<sub>2</sub>-x<sub>3</sub> plane of isotropy (in the global RUC
coordinates).</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
8)&nbsp;&nbsp; Shear CTEs are engineering quantities. That is, for
example, <span style='position:relative; top:5.0pt'><img border="0"
width="81" height="24" src=
"MAC-GMC-4.0-Keywords-Manual-6_files/image014.png"></span>.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
9)&nbsp;&nbsp; When a user-defined&nbsp;constitutive model&nbsp;is
selected (<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>CMOD=</span></span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>99</span></span>),
MAC/GMC 4.0 will use the code in the file <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span><span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>.F90</span></span>
to determine the inelastic strain increments for any subcells
contain that particular material<span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>.&nbsp;
The MAC/GMC 4.0 executable that is distributed has been linked with
the demonstration</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine,
the source</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;code
of which is also distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0 (see Appendix).&nbsp;
In order</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;for
users to employ their own</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine,
it is necessary to place the appropriate code in the</span></span>
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat.F90</span></span> file and to
compile&nbsp;the subroutine and link&nbsp;with the MAC/GMC 4.0
library file&nbsp;(<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>mac4.lib</span></span>),
which is also distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0.<span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>&nbsp; This
procedure results</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;in a
new MAC/GMC 4.0 executable file</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;that
is now linked to the user&CloseCurlyQuote;s own</span></span>
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
rather than the demonstration version of</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>distributed
with the code.&nbsp; It is the user&CloseCurlyQuote;s
responsibility to ensure that the coding, compilation, and linking
of the user&CloseCurlyQuote;s own</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
is done correctly and that the desired user-defined constitutive
model is actually being employed when the code is executed.&nbsp; A
printout of the demonstration</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
that is distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0 is given in the Appendix of
this manual.&nbsp; Note that when the code executes the
demonstration version of the</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine,
a message is printed to the screen.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
10) When a user-defined&nbsp;constitutive model&nbsp;is selected
(<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>CMOD=</span></span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>99</span></span>),
MAC/GMC 4.0 will use the code in the file <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrformde</span></span><span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>.F90</span></span>
to calculate the material elastic stiffness matrix&nbsp;from the
user-defined elastic properties<span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>.&nbsp;
This is necessary because the user is free to employ any elastic
constants desired (e.g., Lam&eacute;
constants</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>,
compliance components).&nbsp; Thus the code does not (in general)
know how to form the stiffness matrix from the
user&CloseCurlyQuote;s elastic constants.&nbsp; As with
the</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span>&nbsp;file,
t<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>he MAC/GMC
4.0 executable that is distributed has been linked with a
demonstration</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrformde</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine,
the source</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;code
of which is also distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0 (see Appendix).&nbsp;
It is the user&CloseCurlyQuote;s responsibility to ensure that the
coding, compilation, and linking of the user&CloseCurlyQuote;s
own</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrformde</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
is done correctly and that the stiffness matrix of the
user&CloseCurlyQuote;s material is being calculated correctly when
the code is executed.&nbsp; A printout of the
demonstration</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrformde</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
that is distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0 is given in the Appendix of
this manual. &nbsp;Note that when the code executes the
demonstration version of the</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrformde</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine,
a message is printed to the screen.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
11) For a user-defined&nbsp;elastic constitutive model, set
<i>npv</i> = 0 and omit the <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>V1 &ndash; V<i>nvp</i></span></span>
<span style='color:black'>lines. </span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'><br clear=
"all" style='page-break-before:auto'></span>
<div class="WordSection7">
<div style=
'border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt; background:#CCFFFF'>
<p class="MsoNormal" style=
'background:#CCFFFF;border:none;padding:0in'><b><span style=
'font-size:14.0pt;color:black'>B. Material properties determined
from a user-defined</span></b><b><span style=
'font-size:14.0pt;color:black'>&nbsp;function (<i>matdb</i>
=</span></b> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<b><span style=
'font-size:14.0pt;color:black'>2</span></b></span><b><span style=
'font-size:14.0pt;color:black'>)</span></b></p>
</div>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046421"
id="_Toc23046421"></a><a name="_Toc26088601" id=
"_Toc26088601">Usage:</a></h3>
<p class="Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1Char">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1Char">*CONSTITUENTS</p>

&nbsp; NMATS=<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family: "Times New Roman",serif'>nmats</span></span></p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">

'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>matnum</span></span>
CMOD=<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family: "Times New Roman",serif'>cmod</span></span>
<span style='color:blue'>TREF=</span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>tref</span></span>
MATID=<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>matid</span></span>
MATDB=<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family: "Times New Roman",serif'>matdb&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; .</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-style:normal'>&nbsp; .</span></span></p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-style:normal'>&nbsp; .</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='text-indent:.25in'><span style=
'font-family:Symbol'>&REG;</span> Repeated <i>nmats</i> times</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;</p>
<table class="MsoNormalTable" border="0" cellspacing="0"

<tr>
<td width="72" valign="top" style=

<p class="MsoNormal"><u><span style=

</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="72" valign="top" style=
'width:.75in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal"><i>nmats</i></p>
</td>
<td width="534" valign="top" style=
'width:400.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal">Number of constituent materials specified</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="72" valign="top" style=

<p class="MsoNormal"><i>matnum</i></p>
</td>
<td width="534" valign="top" style=
'width:400.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal">Material number (data following <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>M=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>m</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>atnum</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>is
associated with material number</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>matnum</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>)</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family: "Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>numbered
sequentially</span></span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="72" valign="top" style=
'width:.75in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal"><i>cmod</i></p>
</td>
<td width="534" valign="top" style=
'width:400.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal">Constitutive model identification number</p>
</td>

'width:.75in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal"><i><span style='color:blue'>tref</span>
</i><sup>1,2</sup></p>
</td>
<td width="534" valign="top" style=
'width:400.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="MsoNormal">Reference temperature&nbsp;for material
<i><span style='color:blue'>(Special Case)</span></i></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="72" valign="top" style=
'width:.75in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<p class="normalitalicChar1">matid</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char"
align="left" style='text-align:left'>[=U]</p>
</td>

<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; = <span class=

Table 2.2)</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; = <span class=

<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>U</span></span> <span style=

User-defined&nbsp;material properties</p>

align="left" style='text-align:left'>[=2] <sup><span style=

<p class="MsoNormal">= 2 <span style=

<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046422"
id="_Toc23046422"></a><a name="_Toc26088602" id=
"_Toc26088602">Example:</a></h3>
<p class="Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1Char">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1Char">*CONSTITUENTS</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; NMATS=5</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; M=1 CMOD=6&nbsp; MATID=U MATDB=2</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; M=2 CMOD=21 MATID=U MATDB=2</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; M=3 CMOD=1 TREF=650. MATID=U MATDB=2</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; M=4 CMOD=1 TREF=650. MATID=U MATDB=2</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp; M=5 CMOD=99 MATID=U MATDB=2</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;</p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046423"
id="_Toc23046423"></a><a name="_Toc26088603" id=
"_Toc26088603">Associated MAC/GMC 4.0 Example Problem(s):</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=
'font-size:8.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><b>Example 2f</b></p>
<h3 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in'><a name="_Toc23046424"
id="_Toc23046424"></a><a name="_Toc26088604" id=
"_Toc26088604">Notes:</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
1)&nbsp;&nbsp; <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>TREF=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>tref</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>is only
required in the special case</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;when
the code cannot determine at what
temperature</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;the
material properties</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;should
be taken.&nbsp; This special case occurs when:</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol;font-style:normal'>&CenterDot;</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>Thermal
loading</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;is
not specified (</span></span><span class=
"Code10BoldCharCharCharCharChar1CharChar">*THERM</span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>omitted)</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&ndash; AND &ndash;&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:Symbol;font-style:normal'>&CenterDot;</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>Material
properties are taken from the internal material
database</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span>(<i>matid</i>
<span style='font-family:Symbol'>&sup1;</span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>U</span></span>)</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:9.0pt'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&ndash; OR
&ndash;&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:9.0pt'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>Material
properties are user-defined</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span>(<i>matid</i>
= <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>U</span></span>)<span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>&nbsp;
&ndash; AND &ndash;&nbsp; temperature</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>-dependent</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
2)&nbsp;&nbsp; In all other cases <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>TREF=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>tref</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>is
optional</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in'><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><u><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>Warning</span></u></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>:
Specifying</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style=
'font-size:10.0pt;color:blue'>TREF=</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:blue'>tref</span></span>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>will
override the temperature</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;dependence
and cause the code to employ
temperature-independent</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;material
properties</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;for
the material taken at the temperature </span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;color:blue'>tref</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
3)&nbsp;&nbsp; When a user-defined&nbsp;function is selected to
determine a material&CloseCurlyQuote;s properties (<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>MATDB=</span></span><span class="Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>2</span></span>),
MAC/GMC 4.0 will use the code in the file <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span><span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>.F90</span></span>
to determine the material properties&nbsp;at every increment of the
simulated applied loading<span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>.&nbsp;
The MAC/GMC 4.0 executable that is distributed has been linked with
the demonstration</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine,
the source</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;code
of which is also distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0 (see Appendix).&nbsp;
In order</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;for
users to employ their own</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine,
it is necessary to place the appropriate code in the</span></span>
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun.F90</span></span> file and to
compile&nbsp;the subroutine and link&nbsp;with the MAC/GMC 4.0
library file&nbsp;(<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>mac4.lib</span></span>),
which is also distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0.<span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>&nbsp; This
procedure results</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;in a
new MAC/GMC 4.0 executable file</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;that
is now linked to the user&CloseCurlyQuote;s own</span></span>
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
rather than the demonstration version of</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>distributed
with the code.&nbsp; It is the user&CloseCurlyQuote;s
responsibility to ensure that the coding, compilation, and linking
of the user&CloseCurlyQuote;s own</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
is done correctly and that the desired user-defined function is
actually being employed when the code is executed.&nbsp; A printout
of the demonstration</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
that is distributed with MAC/GMC 4.0 is given in the Appendix of
this manual.&nbsp; Note that when the code executes the
demonstration version of the</span></span> <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine,
a message is printed to the screen.&nbsp; The</span></span>
<span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
<span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrfun</span></span> <span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-style:normal'>subroutine
can be used to allow the elastic and inelastic material properties
to be a function of temperature</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;or
another variable.&nbsp; It works in concert with the MAC/GMC
internal constitutive model</span></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>s as well
as the user-defined constitutive model subroutine
(</span></span><span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar"><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>usrmat</span></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>).</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
4)&nbsp;&nbsp; In MAC/GMC 4.0, the material properties&nbsp;are
associated with constituent materials as opposed to subcells.&nbsp;
That is, several subcells may contain material number&nbsp;1, and
thus all of those subcells must have the same material
properties.&nbsp; This is relevant when employing the <span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar">
usrfun</span><span class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar">.F90</span>
subroutine to make material properties a function of field
variables&nbsp;(as is done in Example Problem 2f).&nbsp; If, for
instance, the properties of material number 1 are determined from a
function of strain and material number 1 is placed in two subcells,
the subcells will in general experience different strain
states.&nbsp; It is thus impossible for material number 1 to have
the correct material properties to correspond to the two different
states of strain in each subcell.&nbsp; For this reason, when
material properties are determined from a function of field
variables (other than temperature, which does not vary within the
repeating unit cell), each subcell should be given its own
material.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style='margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in'>
<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; font-style:normal'>&nbsp;</span></span></p>

id="_Toc23046425"></a><a name="_Toc26088605" id=
"_Toc26088605">Additional Information:</a></h3>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=

external material database</span></b><b><span style=

"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar">

<span style='color:blue'>TREF=</span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><span style=

MATID=<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif'>matid</span></span>

EXTMAT=<span class="normalitalicChar"><span style=

<p class=

<p class=

<table class="MsoNormalTable" border="0" cellspacing="0"
cellpadding="0" style='margin-left:5.4pt;border-collapse:collapse'>

<p class=

<p class=

&nbsp;</span></span></p>

Example portion of the external material
database</span></u></span><span class=
"normalitalicChar"><u><span style=
'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:black;font-style:normal'>&nbsp;file</span></u></span><span class="normalitalicChar"><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman",serif; color:black;font-style:normal'>:</span></span></p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
#</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
# ------- Bodner-Partom&nbsp;Model Material</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
MAT=copper</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;CMOD=1</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;EL=120.E9,120.E9,0.33,0.33,45.11E9,14.7E-6,14.7E-6 &</p>
<p class=
"Code10CharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharCharChar1CharCharCharCharCharCharChar1Char2Char">
&nbsp;VI=1.E4,63.E6,250.E6,8.19,7.5,0.55</p>
<p class=

&nbsp;K=1.,2.</p>
<p class=
